theorem mathd_algebra_113:
  fixes x ::real
  shows "x^2 - 14 * x + 3 \<ge> 7^2 - 14 * 7 + 3"
proof -
  have "x^2 - 14 * x + 3 = (x - 7)^2 - 46" by sos
  moreover have "(x - 7)^2 \<ge> 0" by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12b_2002_p2:
  fixes x ::int
  assumes h0: "x = 4" 
  shows "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x) + 1 = 11"
proof -
  have c0: "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x) + 1 = (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1 - 4 * x) + 1"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have c1: "4 * x + 1 - 4 * x = 1"
  by simp
  have " (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1 - 4 * x) + 1 = (3 * x - 2) * 1 + 1"
  using c0 c1 by auto
  then have " (3 * x - 2) * 1 + 1 = 3 * x - 1"
  by simp
  then have "3 * x - 1 = 11"
  using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis
  by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_113:
  fixes x ::real
  shows "x^2 - 14 * x + 3 \<ge> 7^2 - 14 * 7 + 3"
proof -
  have c0: "x^2 - 14 * x + 3 = (x - 7)^2 - 46" by (simp add: power2_diff)
  have c1: "(x - 7)^2 \<ge> 0" by auto
  have c2: "(x - 7)^2 - 46 \<ge> 0 - 46" using c1 by simp
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma f_definition:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x \<noteq> -2. f x = 1 / (x + 2)"
  shows "f 1 = 1 / (1 + 2)"
  using assms by auto

theorem mathd_algebra_270:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x \<noteq> -2. f x = 1 / (x + 2)" 
  shows "f (f 1) = 3/7"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 1 / (1 + 2)"
    using assms f_definition by auto
  hence "f (f 1) = f (1 / 3)" using assms by auto
  hence "f (f 1) = 1 / (1 / 3 + 2)" using assms by auto
  thus ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_171:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 5 * x + 4" 
  shows "f 1 = 9"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 5 * 1 + 4"
    using assms by simp
  then have "f 1 = 9"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_113:
  fixes x ::real
  shows "x^2 - 14 * x + 3 \<ge> 7^2 - 14 * 7 + 3"
proof -
  have c0: "x^2 - 14 * x + 3 = (x^2 - 14 * x + 49) - 46" by simp
  have c1: "(x^2 - 14 * x + 49) - 46 = (x - 7)^2 - 46" by sos
  have c2: "(x - 7)^2 \<ge> 0" by auto
  have c3: "(x - 7)^2 - 46 \<ge> 0 - 46" using c2 by simp
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma substitute_values:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + c = 1" "a = 50" "b = -139"
  shows "c = 90"
proof -
  have "a + b + c = 50 + (-139) + c" using assms by simp
  hence "c = 1 - (50 + (-139))" using assms by simp
  hence "c = 1 - 50 + 139" by simp
  hence "c = 90" by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  have "5 * (a + b + c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  then have "5 * (a + b + c) = 25"
    by simp
  then have "a + b + c = 5"
    by simp
  then have "2 * a = -8"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "2 * b = 4"
    using assms(2) by (smt (verit) assms(3))
  then have "2 * c = 14"
    using assms(3) by (smt (verit) assms(2))
  then have "a = -4"
    by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * a = - 8\<close>)
  then have "b = 2"
    by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * b = 4\<close>)
  then have "c = 7"
    by (metis \<open>2 * b = 4\<close> \<open>a + b + c = 5\<close> \<open>a = - 4\<close> add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' add_diff_cancel_right' add_minus_cancel dbl_dec_def dbl_dec_simps(5) dbl_def dbl_inc_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(4) diff_add_cancel diff_minus_eq_add left_add_twice minus_add_cancel minus_diff_eq minus_real_def mult_2 semiring_norm(26) semiring_norm(27) uminus_add_conv_diff verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "a * b * c = -4 * 2 * 7"
    by (metis \<open>a = - 4\<close> \<open>b = 2\<close>)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
  using mathd_algebra_338[OF assms] .

lemma aime_1989_p8:
  fixes a b c d e f g :: real
  assumes "a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g = 1"
    and "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g = 12"
    and "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g = 123" 
  shows "16 * a + 25 * b + 36 * c + 49 * d + 64 * e + 81 * f + 100 * g = 334"
proof -
  let ?k = "-14"
  have eq1: "a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g = 1"
    using assms by simp
  have eq2: "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g = 12"
    using assms by simp
  have eq3: "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g = 123"
    using assms by simp
  have eq4: "50 * ?k^2 - 139 * ?k + 90 = ?k^2 * (a) + (?k+1)^2 * (b) + (?k+2)^2 * (c) + (?k+3)^2 * (d) + (?k+4)^2 * (e) + (?k+5)^2 * (f) + (?k+6)^2 * (g)"
    using eq1 eq2 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "16 * a + 25 * b + 36 * c + 49 * d + 64 * e + 81 * f + 100 * g = 334"
    using eq4 by (smt (verit) eq1 eq2 eq3)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_equation_system:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "3 * a = b + c + d"
    and "4 * b = a + c + d"
    and "2 * c = a + b + d"
    and "8 * a + 10 * b + 6 * c = 24"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 4/5 \<and> c = 4/3 \<and> d = 13/15"
proof -
  have eq1: "4 * a = 3 * c" using assms by simp
  have eq2: "5 * b = 3 * c" using assms by simp
  have eq3: "4 * a = 5 * b" using eq1 eq2 by simp
  have eq4: "4 * a = 3 * c" using eq1 by simp
  have eq5: "5 * b = 3 * c" using eq2 by simp
  have eq6: "4 = 3 * c" using assms eq4 eq5 by simp
  have eq7: "a = 1" using assms eq3 eq6 by simp
  have eq8: "b = 4/5" using assms eq3 eq6 by simp
  have eq9: "c = 4/3" using assms eq3 eq6 by simp
  have eq10: "d = 4 - (1 + 4/3 + 4/5)" using assms eq7 eq8 eq9 by simp
  have eq11: "d = 13/15" using eq10 by simp
  show ?thesis using eq7 eq8 eq9 eq11 by simp
qed
data/full_data/test/aime_1990_p15.json:
lemma mult_zero_iff:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "a * b = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> a = 0 \<or> b = 0"
  by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "180 = ?a * (27 - ?a)"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "0 = ?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "(?a - 12) * (?a - 15) = 0"
    using eq5 by sos
  have eq7: "?a = 12 \<or> ?a = 15"
    using eq6 mult_zero_iff by auto
  have eq8: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq9: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq7 eq8 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  have c0: "\<And>(x::real). f x = a*x^4 - b*x^2 + x + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  have c1: "f (-3) = a*(-3)^4 - b*(-3)^2 + (-3) + 5" using c0 by simp
  have c2: "f 3 = a*(3)^4 - b*(3)^2 + (3) + 5" using c0 by simp
  have c3: "f 3 - f (-3) = (a*(3)^4 - b*(3)^2 + (3) + 5) - (a*(-3)^4 - b*(-3)^2 + (-3) + 5)" using c1 c2 by simp
  have c4: "f 3 = f (-3) + 6" using c3 by simp
  have c5: "f 3 = 2 + 6" using c4 assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_246_generalized:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
proof
  fix x :: real
  have "f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5" using assms(1) by simp
  then show "f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5" by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = x"
    and "b * (c + a) = y"
    and "c * (a + b) = z"
  shows "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = x + y + z"
proof -
  have "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = 2*a*b + 2*b*c + 2*c*a"
    by simp
  also have "... = a*b + a*b + b*c + b*c + c*a + c*a"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a*b + b*a + c*b + b*c + a*c + c*a"
    by (simp add: ac_simps)
  also have "... = a*b + c*a + b*c + b*a + c*b + a*c"
    by (simp add: ac_simps)
  also have "... = a*(b + c) + b*(c + a) + c*(a + b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = x + y + z"
    using assms by simp
  finally show "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = x + y + z" .
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = x"
    and "b * (c + a) = y"
    and "c * (a + b) = z"
  shows "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = x + y + z"
proof -
  have "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = (a*b + b*c) + (b*c + c*a) + (c*a + a*b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (a*b + c*a) + (b*c + a*b) + (c*a + b*c)"
    by (simp add: add.assoc)
  also have "... = (a * (b + c)) + (b * (c + a)) + (c * (a + b))"
    by sos
  also have "... = x + y + z"
    using assms by simp
  finally show "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = x + y + z" .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  have "2 * (a + b) = 2 * 2" using assms(2) by simp
  hence "3 * a + 2 * b - (2 * a + 2 * b) = 5 - 4" using assms(1) by simp
  hence "a = 1" using assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms(2) by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_107:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = 0" 
  shows "(x + 4)^2 + (y-3)^2 = 5^2"
proof -
  have c1: "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 - 25 = 0"
    using assms by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  have c2: "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 25"
    using c1 by simp
  show ?thesis
    using c2 by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have c0: "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" using assms(1) by auto
  then have c1: "f 5 = 7" by auto
  have c2: "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" using c1 assms(2) by auto
  have c3: "g 6 = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by auto
  have c4: "6 + 1 = 7" by auto
  show ?thesis using c2 c3 c4 by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have "f 5 - 1 = 2 * 5 - 3 - 1" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "f 5 - 1 = 6" by simp
  then have "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" by simp
  then have "g (f 5 - 1) = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by simp
  then show "g (f 5 - 1) = 7" by simp
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"

theorem solve_linear_equation:
  fixes x a b :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  assumes "x / a = b"
  shows "x = a * b"
proof -
  have "a * (x / a) = a * b"
    using assms by simp
  then have "x = a * b"
    using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma equation_rewrite:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "abs (x - 1/x) = 1"
  shows "(x^2 - x - 1 = 0 \<or> x^2 + x - 1 = 0)"
proof (rule ccontr)
  assume "\<not> (x^2 - x - 1 = 0 \<or> x^2 + x - 1 = 0)"
  then have "x^2 - x - 1 \<noteq> 0" and "x^2 + x - 1 \<noteq> 0"
    by simp_all
  then have "abs (x - 1/x) \<noteq> 1"
    by sos
  then show False
    using assms by simp
qed

lemma induction_base_cases:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + 0*x) \<le> (1 + x)^0" and "(1 + 1*x) \<le> (1 + x)^1"
proof -
  have "(1 + 0*x) = 1"
    by simp
  then have "(1 + 0*x) \<le> (1 + x)^0"
    by simp
  moreover have "(1 + 1*x) = (1 + x)"
    by simp
  then have "(1 + 1*x) \<le> (1 + x)^1"
    by simp
  ultimately show "(1 + 0*x) \<le> (1 + x)^0" and "(1 + 1*x) \<le> (1 + x)^1"
    by simp_all
qed

lemma solve_linear_equation:
  fixes x a b :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "a * x = b \<longleftrightarrow> x = b / a"
proof
  assume "a * x = b"
  then have "x = b / a" using assms by auto
  thus "x = b / a" .
next
  assume "x = b / a"
  then have "a * x = a * (b / a)" by simp
  thus "a * x = b" using assms by simp
qed

lemma assms_abcorder:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
    and "a + b + c = 2"
    and "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1" 
  shows "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
proof -
  have "a \<ge> 0"
  proof (rule ccontr)
    assume "\<not> a \<ge> 0"
    then have "a < 0"
      by simp
    have "a * b + b * c + c * a < 0"
      using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) \<open>a < 0\<close> by sos
    then show False
      using assms(3) by simp
  qed
  moreover have "a \<le> b"
    using assms(1) by simp
  moreover have "b \<le> c"
    using assms(1) by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma assms_abcorder:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
    and "a + b + c = 2"
    and "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1" 
  shows "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
proof -
  have "a \<ge> 0"
  proof (rule ccontr)
    assume "\<not> a \<ge> 0"
    then have "a < 0" by simp
    then have "a * b + b * c + c * a < 0"
      using assms by sos
    moreover have "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1"
      using assms by simp
    ultimately show False by simp
  qed
  moreover have "a \<le> b" using assms by simp
  moreover have "b \<le> c" using assms by simp
  ultimately show "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c" by simp
qed

lemma cal_log_exp_value:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "a ≠ 1" "n > 0"
  shows "log a (a^n) = n"
proof -
  have c0: "log a a = 1"
    by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2))
  have "log a (a^n) = n * (log a a)"
    using log_nat_power[of a a n] by (simp add: assms(1))
  then have c1: "log a (a^n) = n"
    using c0 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: c1)
qed

  shows "a * x + b = c * x"

  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_302:
  "(\<i> / 2)^2 = -(1 / 4)"
proof -
  have "(\<i> / 2)^2 = (\<i>^2) / (2^2)"

    by simp
  also have "... = -(1 / 4)"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis

qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1_lemma1:
  fixes a b:: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "0 \<le> 2 - 2*a*b - 2*a + 2*b"
proof -
  have "(a - 1)^2 + (b + 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 - 2*a + 1 + b^2 + 2*b + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "a^2 + b^2 - 2*a + 2*b + 2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "2 - 2*a*b - 2*a + 2*b \<ge> 0" using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma amc12_2000_p12_lemma1:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0: "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"

proof -

    by sos
  also have "... = a * b + a + b - 12"
    by simp

    by auto
  also have "... \<le> a * b + a + b"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis .

lemma algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1_lemma1:
  fixes a b:: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "0 \<le> (1 - a)^2 + b^2"
proof -
  have "(1 - a)^2 + b^2 = 1 - 2*a + a^2 + b^2" by (simp add: power2_diff)
  also have "... = 1 - 2*a + (a^2 + b^2)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 1 - 2*a + 1" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 2 - 2*a" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by sos
qed

theorem algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1:
  fixes a b:: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b + (a - b) \<le> 1"
proof -
  have "(a - b - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2 + 2*a - 2*b + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "2 - 2*a*b - 2*a + 2*b \<ge> 0" using assms by sos
  then have "a * b + (a - b) \<le> 1" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

    \<comment> \<open>$$ab + a + b + 1 \leq ab + a + b + 1$$\<close>
    if "0 < a" "0 < b" for a b :: real

theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -
  have "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 - 2*a + 1 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: power2_diff)
  then have "2*a - a^2 \<le> 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a^2 - 2*a + 1 - a^2 + 2*a - 1 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "(a-1)^2 \<ge> 0" by auto
  then have "a^2 - 2*a + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "2*a - a^2 \<le> 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1" by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebra_amgm_sumasqdivbgeqsuma_lemma2:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes h0: "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c \<and> 0 < d" 
  shows "(a + b + c + d)^2 \<ge> (a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2)"
proof -

    by sos
  moreover have "2*(a*b + a*c + a*d + b*c + b*d + c*d) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma square_expression:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0"
proof -
  have "(a - 1)^2 = a^2 - 2*a + 1"
    by (simp add: power2_diff)
  then have "a^2 - 2*a + 1 \<ge> 0"
    by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -

  then have "a^2 - 2*a + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "2*a - a^2 \<le> 1" by simp
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

  shows "odd (p * q)"

    using assms by (smt (verit) distrib_left_numeral le_square mult_2 nat_1_add_1 nle_le numeral_Bit0 numeral_eq_iff one_eq_numeral_iff prime_prime_factor prime_prime_factor_sqrt primes_dvd_imp_eq semiring_norm(87) two_is_prime_nat)
  then show ?thesis

lemma prime_odd_nat:
  fixes p q :: nat
  assumes "prime p \<and> prime q"
    and "4 \<le> p \<and> p \<le> 18"
    and "4 \<le> q \<and> q \<le> 18"
  shows "odd (p * q)"
proof -
  have "odd (p * q) \<longleftrightarrow> odd p \<and> odd q"
    by simp
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> (4 \<le> p \<and> p \<le> 18) \<and> (4 \<le> q \<and> q \<le> 18)"
    using assms by (simp add: prime_odd_nat)

  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "prime p"

  using assms by (simp add: prime_nat_iff)

lemma prime_odd_nat:
  fixes p q :: nat
  assumes "prime p \<and> prime q"
    and "4 \<le> p \<and> p \<le> 18"
    and "4 \<le> q \<and> q \<le> 18"
  shows "odd (p * q)"
proof -

    using assms prime_imp_neq_one by blast
  then show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) numeral_le_iff prime_dvd_multD primes_dvd_imp_eq semiring_norm(69) semiring_norm(71) two_is_prime_nat)

lemma prime_odd_nat:
  fixes p q :: nat
  assumes "prime p \<and> prime q"
    and "4 \<le> p \<and> p \<le> 18"
    and "4 \<le> q \<and> q \<le> 18"
  shows "odd (p * q)"
proof -

    using assms by (simp add: prime_odd_nat)

    by (simp add: prime_odd_nat)

lemma factors_of_number:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "{f. f dvd n} = {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
proof
  show "{f. f dvd n} \<subseteq> {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
  proof
    fix x
    assume "x \<in> {f. f dvd n}"
    then have "x dvd n" by simp
    then have "x > 0 \<and> x dvd n" using assms by auto
    then show "x \<in> {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}" by simp
  qed
next
  show "{f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n} \<subseteq> {f. f dvd n}"
  proof
    fix x
    assume "x \<in> {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
    then have "x > 0" and "x dvd n" by simp_all
    then show "x \<in> {f. f dvd n}" by simp
  qed
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_24:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x / n = m"
  assumes "n \<noteq> 0"
  shows "x = m * n"
proof -
  have "n * (x / n) = n * m"
    using assms by simp
  then have "x = m * n"
    using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma inequality_true:
  fixes n0 :: nat
  assumes "n0 \<ge> 1"
  shows "n0^2 - n0 + 2 \<ge> 0"
proof -
  have "(n0 - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "n0^2 - 2*n0 + 1 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: power2_diff)
  then have "n0^2 - n0 + 1 + 1 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma even_product_is_even:
  fixes m n :: nat
  assumes "even m \<or> even n"
  shows "even (m * n)"
proof (cases "even m")
  case True
  then show ?thesis
    by (metis assms even_mult_iff)
next
  case False
  then have "even n"
    using assms
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by (metis even_mult_iff False)
qed

lemma factors_of_number:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "{f. f dvd n} = {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
proof -
  have "{f. f dvd n} \<subseteq> {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
    by (metis Collect_mono assms conj_subset_def dvd_0_left less_numeral_extra(3) subset_refl zero_less_iff_neq_zero)
  moreover have "{f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n} \<subseteq> {f. f dvd n}"
    by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by blast
qed

lemma amc12_2000_p12_lemma:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes h0: "a \<ge> 0 \<and> b \<ge> 0 \<and> c \<ge> 0"
  shows "(a+1)*(b+1)*(c+1) - 13 \<le> a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c"
proof -
  have "(a+1)*(b+1)*(c+1) - 13 = a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c + 1 - 13"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c - 12"
    by simp
  also have "... = a*b*c + (a*b + a*c + b*c) + (a + b + c) - 12"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... \<le> a*b*c + (a*b + a*c + b*c) + (a + b + c)"
    using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma amc12_2000_p12_lemma:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes h0: "a \<ge> 0 \<and> b \<ge> 0 \<and> c \<ge> 0"
  shows "(a+1)*(b+1)*(c+1) - 13 \<le> a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c"
proof -
  have "(a+1)*(b+1)*(c+1) - 13 = a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c + 1 - 13"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c - 12"
    by simp
  also have "... = a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + (a + b + c) - 12"
    by auto
  also have "... \<le> a*b*c + a*b + a*c + b*c + a + b + c"
    using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = x"
    and "b * (c + a) = y"
    and "c * (a + b) = z"
  shows "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = x + y + z"
proof -
  have "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = (a*b + b*c) + (b*c + c*a) + (c*a + a*b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (a*b + b*c + a*c) + (b*c + c*a + a*b)"
    by (simp add: ac_simps)
  also have "... = (a * (b + c) + b * (c + a)) + (c * (a + b))"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = x + y + z"
    using assms by simp
  finally show "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = x + y + z" .
qed

lemma amc12b_2002_p19_helper:
  fixes a b c::real
  assumes h0: "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and h1: "a * (b + c) = 152"
    and h2: "b * (c + a) = 162"
    and h3: "c * (a + b) = 170"
  shows "a * b * c = 720"
proof -
  have c0: "2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) = 152 + 162 + 170"
    using algebraic_manipulation[OF h1 h2 h3] by simp
  have c1: "a*b + b*c + c*a = 242"
    using h0 c0 by simp
  have c2: "a*b = 72" using c1 h1 by (smt (verit) distrib_left h2 mult.commute)
  have c3: "b*c = 90" using c1 h2 by (smt (verit) distrib_left h1 mult.commute)
  have c4: "c*a = 80" using c1 h3 by (smt (verit) c2 c3)
  have c5: "a^2*b^2*c^2 = 90 * 80 * 72" using c2 c3 c4 by sos
  have c6: "a^2*b^2*c^2 = 720^2" using c5 by simp
  have c7: "a*b*c = 720" using real_sqrt_unique c6 h0 by (smt (verit) less_eq_real_def real_sqrt_abs real_sqrt_mult)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12b_2002_p19:
  fixes a b c::real
  assumes h0: "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and h1: "a * (b + c) = 152"
    and h2: "b * (c + a) = 162"
    and h3: "c * (a + b) = 170"
  shows "a * b * c = 720"
  using amc12b_2002_p19_helper[OF h0 h1 h2 h3] by simp

lemma simplify_powr:
  fixes m n :: real
  shows "12 powr (m * n) = (2 powr m) powr (2*n) * (3 powr n) powr m"
proof -
  have "12 powr (m * n) = (2^2 * 3) powr (m * n)" by simp
  also have "... = (2^2) powr (m * n) * 3 powr (m * n)" by (metis mult.commute mult_2_right numeral_Bit0 power2_eq_square powr_mult zero_le_numeral)
  also have "... = ((2 powr 2) powr m) powr n * (3 powr n) powr m" by (smt (verit) dbl_simps(3) dbl_simps(5) diff_numeral_special(2) mult.commute mult_right_cancel powr_eq_0_iff powr_numeral powr_powr sub_num_simps(1))
  also have "... = (2 powr (2 * m)) powr n * (3 powr n) powr m" by (metis mult.commute mult.left_commute mult_2_right powr_powr powr_powr_swap)
  also have "... = (2 powr m) powr (2 * n) * (3 powr n) powr m" by (metis mult.commute mult.left_commute mult_2_right powr_powr powr_powr_swap)
  finally show "12 powr (m * n) = (2 powr m) powr (2*n) * (3 powr n) powr m" by auto
qed

lemma exponent_manipulation:
  fixes p q :: real
  shows "p powr (2 * n) * (q powr m) = (p powr 2) powr n * (q powr m)"
proof -
  have "p powr (2 * n) * (q powr m) = (p powr (2 * n)) * (q powr m)" by simp
  also have "... = ((p powr 2) powr n) * (q powr m)" by (metis mult.commute mult_2_right powr_powr powr_powr_swap)
  finally show ?thesis by (metis \<open>p powr (2 * n) * q powr m = (p powr 2) powr n * q powr m\<close>)
qed

  have "m * p \<le> m + p" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by auto

lemma amc12a_2013_p4_lemma: 
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)"
proof -
  have "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a / b + b / b) / (a / b - b / b)" using assms
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)" using assms
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp

lemma amc12a_2013_p4_lemma: 
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)"
proof -
  have "(a + b) / (a - b) = ((a + b) * (b / b)) / ((a - b) * (b / b))"
    using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (a * b + b^2) / (a * b - b^2)"
    using assms by sos
  also have "... = (a * b / b^2 + b^2 / b^2) / (a * b / b^2 - b^2 / b^2)"
    using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)"
    using assms by (simp add: divide_simps power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis .

lemma amc12a_2013_p4_lemma:

  finally show ?thesis by simp

lemma amc12a_2013_p4_lemma: 
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)"
  using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)

lemma amc12a_2013_p4_lemma: 
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)"
proof -
  have "(a + b) * (a / b - 1) = (a / b + 1) * (a - b)" using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)
  thus ?thesis using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

lemma amc12a_2013_p4_lemma: 
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)"
proof -
  have "(a + b) / (a - b) = (a + b) * (1 / (a - b))" by simp
  also have "... = (a + b) * (1 / (a - b)) * (b / b)" using assms by simp
  also have "... = (a * b + b^2) / (a * b - b^2)" by sos
  also have "... = (a * b + b^2) * (1 / (a * b - b^2))" by simp
  also have "... = (a * b + b^2) * (1 / (b * (a - b)))" by sos
  also have "... = (a * b + b^2) * (1 / b) * (1 / (a - b))" using assms by simp
  also have "... = b * (a / b + 1) * (1 / (a - b))" by sos
  also have "... = (a / b + 1) * (b / (a - b))" by simp
  also have "... = (a / b + 1) / (a / b - 1)" using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .

lemma prime_properties:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "prime p"
  shows "p > 1"
        "\<And>n. n dvd p \<Longrightarrow> n = 1 \<or> n = p"
proof -
  have "prime p \<longleftrightarrow> p > 1 \<and> (\<forall>n\<in>{2..<p}. \<not> n dvd p)" by (simp add: prime_nat_iff')
  then show "p > 1" using assms by auto
  then show "\<And>n. n dvd p \<Longrightarrow> n = 1 \<or> n = p" using assms by (metis prime_nat_iff)
qed

lemma sum_product_properties:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c"
    and "a * b = b * a"

  show "a * b = b * a" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma units_digit_square:
  fixes x :: nat
  assumes "x mod 10 = d"
  shows "(x^2) mod 10 = (d^2) mod 10"
proof -

    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

    by (metis mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_left_eq semiring_norm(3) semiring_norm(5))
  also have "... = (d * d) mod 10"
    using assms by (metis mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_cong mod_mult_left_eq semiring_norm(3))

    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + y = 17"
    and "5 * y + z = 14"
    and "3 * x + 5 * z = 41" 
  shows "x + y + z = 12"
proof -
  have "3 * x + y + 5 * y + z + 3 * x + 5 * z = 17 + 14 + 41"
    using assms by simp
  then have "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = 72"
    by simp
  then have "(6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z) / 6 = 72 / 6"
    by simp
  then have "x + y + z = 12"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have c0: "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" using assms(1) by auto
  then have c1: "f 5 = 7" by auto
  have c2: "g (f 5 - 1) = g (7 - 1)" using c1 by auto
  have c3: "g (7 - 1) = g 6" by auto
  have c4: "g 6 = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by auto
  have c5: "6 + 1 = 7" by auto
  show ?thesis using c2 c3 c4 c5 by auto
qed

  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = m1 * x + n1"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = m2 * x + n2"
    and "m1 = 2" "n1 = -3" "m2 = 1" "n2 = 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have c0: "f 5 = m1 * 5 + n1" using assms(1) by auto
  then have c1: "f 5 = 7" using assms(3,4) by auto
  have c2: "g (f 5 - 1) = g (7 - 1)" using c1 by auto
  have c3: "g (7 - 1) = g 6" by auto
  have c4: "g 6 = m2 * 6 + n2" using assms(2) by auto
  then have c5: "g 6 = 7" using assms(5,6) by auto
  show ?thesis using c2 c3 c4 c5 by auto
qed

theorem amc12a_2002_p6:
  fixes n ::nat 
  assumes "n>0"
  shows "\<exists> m > n. \<exists> p. m * p \<le> m + p"
proof -
  have "n > 0" using assms by simp
  let ?m = "n+1"
  let ?p = 1
  have "n < n+1" by simp
  have "?m * ?p = ?m" by simp
  have "?m * ?p \<le> ?m + ?p" by simp
  then have "?m \<le> ?m + ?p" by simp
  then have "n+1 \<le> n+2" by simp
  then have "\<exists> m > n. \<exists> p. m * p \<le> m + p" by (metis \<open>(n + 1) * 1 \<le> n + 1 + 1\<close> \<open>n < n + 1\<close>)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p3:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes h0: "x + y = 17402"
    and h1: "10 dvd x"
    and h2: "x div 10 = y" 
  shows "x - y = 14238"
proof -
  define a where "a = y"
  have "x + y = 10 * a + a"
    using h2 a_def by (metis add.commute dvd_mult_div_cancel h1 mult.commute)
  then have c1: "x + y = 11 * a"
    by simp
  have "11 * a = 17402"
    using c1 h0 by simp
  then have "a = 1582"
    by simp
  have c2: "x - y = 10 * a - a"
    using h2 a_def by (smt (verit) dvd_mult_div_cancel h1)
  then have "x - y = 9 * a"
    by simp
  then have "x - y = 9 * 1582"
    using `a = 1582` by simp
  then have "x - y = 14238"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p3_generalized:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes h0: "x + y = n"
    and h1: "10 dvd x"
    and h2: "x div 10 = y" 
    and h3: "n = 10 * m + m"
  shows "x - y = 9 * m"
proof -
  define a where "a = y"
  have "x + y = 10 * a + a"
    using h2 a_def by (metis add.commute dvd_mult_div_cancel h1 mult.commute)
  then have c1: "x + y = 11 * a"
    by simp
  have "11 * a = n"
    using c1 h0 by simp
  then have "a = m"
    using h3 by simp
  have c2: "x - y = 10 * a - a"
    using h2 a_def by (smt (verit) dvd_mult_div_cancel h1)
  then have "x - y = 9 * a"
    by simp
  then have "x - y = 9 * m"
    using `a = m` by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

  let ?p = 1
  have "n < n+1" by simp
  have "?m * ?p = ?m" by simp
  have "?m * ?p \<le> ?m + ?p" by simp
  then have "?m \<le> ?m + ?p" by simp
  then have "n+1 \<le> n+2" by simp
  then have "\<exists> m > n. \<exists> p. m * p \<le> m + p" by (metis \<open>(n + 1) * 1 \<le> n + 1 + 1\<close> \<open>n < n + 1\<close>)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

    by simp

    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

data/full_data/test/induction_11div10ton:
lemma mod_equivalence:
  shows "10 mod 11 = (-1::int) mod 11"
  by simp

lemma dvd_def:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "a dvd b \<longleftrightarrow> (\<exists>k. b = a * k)"
proof
  assume "a dvd b"
  then obtain k where "b = a * k"
    using dvdE[of a b] by auto
  thus "\<exists>k. b = a * k"
    by blast
next
  assume "\<exists>k. b = a * k"
  then obtain k where "b = a * k"
    by blast
  hence "b = a * k"
    by simp
  thus "a dvd b"
    by (metis dvdI)
qed

lemma congruence_property:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(10::int) ^ n mod 11 = (-1)^n mod 11"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(10::int)^(Suc n) mod 11 = (10::int) * (10::int)^n mod 11"
    by (simp add: power_Suc2)
  also have "... = (10::int) * (-1)^n mod 11"
    using Suc.IH by (metis calculation mod_mult_cong mult.commute)
  also have "... = (-(1::int)) * (-1)^n mod 11"
    by presburger
  also have "... = (-1)^(Suc n) mod 11"
    by simp
  finally show ?case .
qed

lemma dvd_def:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "a dvd b \<longleftrightarrow> (\<exists>k. b = a * k)"
proof
  assume "a dvd b"
  then obtain k where "b = a * k" using dvdE by auto
  thus "\<exists>k. b = a * k" by auto
next
  assume "\<exists>k. b = a * k"
  then obtain k where "b = a * k" by auto
  thus "a dvd b" by simp
qed

lemma inequality_proof:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n" and "x \<le> x * (1 + x)^n"
  shows "(1 + n*x) + x \<le> (1 + x)^n + x * (1 + x)^n"
proof -
  have "(1 + n*x) + x \<le> (1 + x)^n + x"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... \<le> (1 + x)^n + x * (1 + x)^n"
    using assms by (simp add: mult_right_mono)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(1 + n * x) * (1 + x) \<le> (1 + x) ^ n * (1 + x)"
    using Suc.IH assms by auto
  also have "... = (1 + x)^(n+1)"
    by (simp add: power_Suc)
  finally show ?case
    by (metis Bernoulli_inequality add_mono_thms_linordered_semiring(2) assms mult_of_nat_commute order_less_imp_le order_refl order_trans)
qed

lemma x_leq_x1xpowern:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "x \<ge> 0"
  shows "x \<le> x*(1 + x)^n"
proof -
  have "x*(1 + x)^n \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  then have "x*(1 + x)^n + (-x) \<ge> 0 + (-x)"
    by (simp add: assms)
  then have "x*(1 + x)^n + (-x) \<ge> -x"
    by simp
  then have "x*(1 + x)^n + (-x) + x \<ge> -x + x"
    by simp
  then have "x*(1 + x)^n + (-x) + x \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then have "x*(1 + x)^n \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by (metis assms dual_order.refl le_add_same_cancel1 mult.right_neutral mult_left_mono one_le_power order_trans)
qed

lemma induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(1 + n * x) * (1 + x) \<le> (1 + x) ^ n * (1 + x)"
    using Suc.IH assms by auto
  then show ?case by (metis Bernoulli_inequality add_mono_thms_linordered_semiring(2) assms dual_order.strict_implies_order mult.commute order_refl order_trans)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_33:

  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"
    and  "2 * x = 5 * y"
    and "7 * y = 10 * z"
  shows "z / x = 7 / 25"
proof -

    using assms(2) by (simp add: divide_simps)
  have "z = 7/10 * y"
    using assms(3) by (simp add: divide_simps)

  have "z = 7/25 * x"
    by (simp add: \<open>z = 7/10 * (2/5 * x)\<close>)

    using assms(1) by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma fraction_simplification:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a * b) / (c * d) = (a / c) * (b / d)"
proof -
  have "(a * b) / (c * d) = a * b * (1 / (c * d))"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = a * b * (1 / c) * (1 / d)"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (a / c) * (b / d)"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  finally show ?thesis .

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  fixes x y z :: real   
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"

  then show ?thesis by auto

lemma quadratic_equation_rearrangement:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x^2 + (b / a) * x + (c / a) = 0"
proof
  assume "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0"
  then have "a * x^2 = -b * x - c" by simp
  then have "x^2 = (-b / a) * x - (c / a)" using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show "x^2 + (b / a) * x + (c / a) = 0" by simp
next
  assume "x^2 + (b / a) * x + (c / a) = 0"
  then have "a * (x^2 + (b / a) * x + (c / a)) = 0" by simp
  then have "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0" using assms by sos
  then show "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0" .
qed

  fixes a b :: real

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "180 = ?a * (27 - ?a)"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "0 = ?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "(?a - 12) * (?a - 15) = 0"
    using eq5 by sos
  have eq7: "?a = 12 \<or> ?a = 15"
    using eq6 mult_zero_iff by auto
  have eq8: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq9: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq7 eq8 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  have c0: "\<And>(x::real). f x = a*x^4 - b*x^2 + x + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  have c1: "f (-3) = a*(-3)^4 - b*(-3)^2 + (-3) + 5" using c0 by simp
  have c2: "f 3 = a*(3)^4 - b*(3)^2 + (3) + 5" using c0 by simp
  have c3: "f 3 - f (-3) = (a*(3)^4 - b*(3)^2 + (3) + 5) - (a*(-3)^4 - b*(-3)^2 + (-3) + 5)" using c1 c2 by simp
  have c4: "f 3 = f (-3) + 6" using c3 by simp
  have c5: "f 3 = 2 + 6" using c4 assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma inequality_simplification:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "a \<ge> b" "c \<ge> d"
  shows "a + c \<ge> b + d"
proof -
  have "a + c \<ge> b + d" if "a \<ge> b" and "c \<ge> d"
    using that by auto
  then show "a + c \<ge> b + d"
    using assms by simp
qed

lemma floor_division:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "\<lfloor> a / b \<rfloor> = \<lfloor> real_of_int \<lfloor> a / b \<rfloor> \<rfloor>"
proof -
  have "\<lfloor> a / b \<rfloor> \<le> a / b" by auto
  moreover have "\<lfloor> a / b \<rfloor> \<ge> a / b - 1" using assms by auto
  hence "\<lfloor> a / b \<rfloor> \<ge> real_of_int \<lfloor> a / b \<rfloor> - 1" by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma sum_positive_special_generalized:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "\<forall>b > 0. a > b"
  shows "\<forall>b > 0. a + b > a"
proof (rule allI, rule impI)
  fix b :: real
  assume "b > 0"
  have "a > b" using assms and \<open>b > 0\<close> by blast
  hence "a + b > b + b" using assms and \<open>b > 0\<close> by (simp add: add_strict_mono)
  also have "b + b = 2 * b" by simp
  finally show "a + b > a" by (metis \<open>0 < b\<close> less_add_same_cancel1)
qed

  fixes a b :: nat

lemma quadratic_formula:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0"
  shows "x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a)"
proof -
  have "0 = a * x^2 + b * x + c" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "0 = 4 * a^2 * x^2 + 4 * a * b * x + 4 * a * c"
    by sos
  then have "0 = (2 * a * x + b)^2 - (b^2 - 4 * a * c)"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then have "(b^2 - 4 * a * c) = (2 * a * x + b)^2"
    by simp
  then have "sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c) = \<bar>2 * a * x + b\<bar>"
    by simp
  then have "x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c)) / (2 * a)"
    using assms(1) by (auto simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis .
qed

lemma factorize_quadratic:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" and "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0"
  shows "\<exists> r s. a * x^2 + b * x + c = a * (x - r) * (x - s)"
proof -
  have "a * x^2 + b * x + c = a * (x^2 + (b/a) * x + c/a)"
    using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = a * (x^2 + 2 * (b/(2*a)) * x + (b/(2*a))^2 - (b/(2*a))^2 + c/a)"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a * ((x + (b/(2*a)))^2 - (b/(2*a))^2 + c/a)"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a * ((x - (-b/(2*a)))^2 + c/a - (b/(2*a))^2)"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  finally have "a * x^2 + b * x + c = a * (x - (-b/(2*a)))^2 + a * (c/a - (b/(2*a))^2)"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (metis add.right_inverse assms(2) diff_conv_add_uminus mult_eq_0_iff mult_zero_left uminus_add_conv_diff)
qed

lemma quadratic_formula:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "b^2 - 4*a*c \<ge> 0"
  shows "a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 \<Longrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
proof -
  assume "a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0"
  then have "a*x^2 + b*x = -c"
    by simp
  then have "4*a*(a*x^2 + b*x) = 4*a*(-c)"
    by simp
  then have "(2*a*x + b)^2 = b^2 - 4*a*c"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then have "2*a*x + b = sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c) \<or> 2*a*x + b = - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)"

  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (auto simp: field_simps)
qed

lemma sqrt_monotonic:
  fixes a b :: real

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "sqrt (4 + sqrt (16 + 16 * a)) = 2 * sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a))"
proof -
  have "sqrt (4 + sqrt (16 + 16 * a)) = sqrt (2^2 + sqrt ((4 * 4) + (4 * 4 * a)))"
    by simp
  also have "... = sqrt (2^2 + sqrt (4 * (4 + 4 * a)))"
    by simp
  also have "... = sqrt (2^2 + 2 * sqrt (4 + 4 * a))"
    by (metis calculation mult.commute mult_2_right numeral_Bit0 power2_eq_square real_sqrt_four real_sqrt_mult)
  also have "... = sqrt (2^2 + 2 * sqrt (4 * (1 + a)))"
    by simp
  also have "... = sqrt (2^2 + 2 * sqrt (2^2 * (1 + a)))"
    by simp
  also have "... = sqrt (2^2 + 2 * sqrt (2^2) * sqrt (1 + a))"
    by (metis mult.assoc real_sqrt_mult)
  also have "... = sqrt (2^2 + 2 * 2 * sqrt (1 + a))"
    by simp
  also have "... = sqrt (4 + 4 * sqrt (1 + a))"
    by simp
  also have "... = 2 * sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a))"
    by (metis add.commute distrib_left_numeral mult.right_neutral one_add_one real_sqrt_four real_sqrt_mult)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have c0: "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" using assms(1) by auto

  have c2: "g (f 5 - 1) = g (7 - 1)" using c1 by auto
  have c3: "g (7 - 1) = g 6" by auto

    using assms by simp
  then have "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = 72"
    by simp

    by simp

    by simp
qed

lemma quadratic_formula_real_solution:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "b^2 - 4*a*c \<ge> 0"
  shows "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
proof -
  have "a * x^2 + b * x + c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> (2*a) * (a * x^2 + b * x + c) = (2*a) * 0"
    by (metis add.commute assms(1) double_eq_0_iff group_cancel.add1 group_cancel.add2 mult_2 mult_eq_0_iff mult_zero_right power2_eq_square)
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> (2*a) * (a * x^2) + (2*a) * (b * x) + (2*a) * c = 0"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> 2 * a * a * x^2 + 2 * a * b * x + 2 * a * c = 0"
    by (simp add: mult.assoc)
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> 4 * a^2 * x^2 + 4 * a * b * x + 4 * a * c = 0"
    by sos
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> (2 * a * x + b)^2 - b^2 + 4 * a * c = 0"
    by sos
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> (2 * a * x + b)^2 = b^2 - 4 * a * c"
    by auto
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> 2 * a * x + b = sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c) \<or> 2 * a * x + b = -sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c)"
    by (smt (verit) assms(2) power2_eq_iff real_sqrt_pow2_iff)
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b) = 180"
    and "2 * (a + b) = 54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "?a * (27 - ?a) = 180"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180 = 0"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "?a = (- (-27) + sqrt ((-27)^2 - 4*1*180)) / (2*1) \<or> ?a = (- (-27) - sqrt ((-27)^2 - 4*1*180)) / (2*1)"
    using quadratic_formula_real_solution[of 1 "-27" 180 ?a] eq5 by simp
  have eq7: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq8: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq6 eq7 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum>i\<in>{1..n}. (2*i-1)) = n^2"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(\<Sum>i\<in>{1..Suc n}. (2*i-1)) = (\<Sum>i\<in>{1..n}. (2*i-1)) + (2*(Suc n)-1)"
    by simp
  also have "... = n^2 + (2*(Suc n)-1)"
    using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = (n+1)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

lemma fraction_simplification:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" and "b \<noteq> 0" and "c \<noteq> 0" and "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a / b) * (c / d) = (a * c) / (b * d)"
proof -
  have "(a / b) * (c / d) = (a * c) / (b * d)"
    using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_441:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" 
  shows "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = 10"
proof -
  have "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = (12 / (x * x)) * ((x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)))"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (12 / (x * x)) * ((x^4 * 35) / ((14 * x) * (3 * x)))"
    by (simp add: fraction_simplification)
  also have "... = ((12 * 35 * x^4) / (x * x * (14 * x) * (3 * x)))"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = ((12 * 35 * x^4) / (14 * 3 * x^3 * x))"
    by sos
  also have "... = 10"
    using assms by sos
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

    by sos

    by sos
  also have "... = (12 * 35) / (14 * 3)"
    using assms by (simp add: power_add divide_simps)
  also have "... = 10"

  finally show ?thesis .

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "180 = ?a * (27 - ?a)"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "0 = ?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "(?a - 12) * (?a - 15) = 0"
    using eq5 by sos
  have eq7: "?a = 12 \<or> ?a = 15"
    using eq6 mult_zero_iff by auto
  have eq8: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq9: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq7 eq8 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_141_extended:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b) = 180"
    and "2 * (a + b) = 54"
    and "a \<noteq> 0"

  then show ?thesis
    by auto

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum>i\<in>{1..n}. (2*i-1)) = n^2"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(\<Sum>i\<in>{1..Suc n}. (2*i-1)) = (\<Sum>i\<in>{1..n}. (2*i-1)) + (2*(Suc n)-1)"
    by simp
  also have "... = n^2 + (2*(Suc n)-1)"
    using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = (n+1)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

  "91^2 = (8281::nat)"
  by (simp add: sum_of_odd_numbers)

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -

    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "a ≠ 1" "n > 0"
  shows "log a (a^n) = n"
proof -
  have c0: "log a a = 1"
    by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2))
  have "log a (a^n) = n * (log a a)"
    using log_nat_power[of a a n] by (simp add: assms(1))
  then have c1: "log a (a^n) = n"
    using c0 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: c1)
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"

    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)

  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x"
    and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" 
  shows "x = 3" and "y = 1"
proof -
  have eq1: "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11" using assms(1) assms(2) by simp
  have eq2: "6 * y + 5 * y = 11" using eq1 by simp
  have eq3: "11 * y = 11" using eq2 by simp
  have eq4: "y = 1" using eq3 by simp
  have eq5: "3 * y = 3" using eq4 by simp
  show "x = 3" using eq5 assms(1) by simp
  show "y = 1" using eq4 by simp
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:

  assumes "3 * y = x"
    and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" 
  shows "x = 3" and "y = 1"
proof -
  have eq1: "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by simp
  have eq2: "6 * y + 5 * y = 11"
    using eq1 by simp
  have eq3: "11 * y = 11"
    using eq2 by simp
  have eq4: "y = 1"
    using eq3 by simp
  have eq5: "3 * 1 = x"
    using assms(1) eq4 by simp
  have eq6: "x = 3"
    using eq5 by simp
  show "x = 3" and "y = 1"
    using eq4 eq6 by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_427:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + y = 17"
    and "5 * y + z = 14"

  shows "x + y + z = 12"
proof -

    using assms by simp
  then have "6 * (x + y + z) = 72"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  then have "x + y + z = 12"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma three_numbers_sum_inequality:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<ge> b" and "a \<ge> c"
  shows "a \<ge> b + c"
proof -
  have "a - b \<ge> 0" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "a - b + (a - c) = 2*a - (b + c)" by algebra
  also have "... \<ge> 0" using assms(2) by simp
  finally have "2*a - (b + c) \<ge> 0" .
  then show "a \<ge> b + c" by simp
qed

lemma mult_zero_iff:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "a * b = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> a = 0 \<or> b = 0"
  by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "180 = ?a * (27 - ?a)"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "0 = ?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "(?a - 12) * (?a - 15) = 0"
    using eq5 by sos
  have eq7: "?a = 12 \<or> ?a = 15"
    using eq6 mult_zero_iff by auto
  have eq8: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq9: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq7 eq8 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

  assumes "x + y = 25"
    and "x - y = 11" 
  shows "x = 18" and "y = 7"
proof -
  have eq1: "x = (x + y)/2 + (x - y)/2" 
    by (auto simp: field_simps)

    using assms(1) assms(2) eq1

theorem mathd_algebra_427:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + y = 17"
    and "5 * y + z = 14"
    and "3 * x + 5 * z = 41" 
  shows "x + y + z = 12"

  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis

    by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_148:

  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma fraction_simplification:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a * b) / (c * d) = (a / c) * (b / d)"
proof -
  have "(a * b) / (c * d) = a * b * (1 / (c * d))"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = a * b * (1 / c) * (1 / d)"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (a / c) * (b / d)"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

    using eq2 eq1 by simp

lemma solve_quotient_of_d:
  fixes a b c d::rat
  assumes "a = 1" "b = 4/5" "c = 4/3"
    and "3 * a = b + c + d"
    and "4 * b = a + c + d"
    and "2 * c = a + b + d"
  shows "fst (quotient_of d) + snd (quotient_of d) = 28"
proof -
  have "4 * a = 3 * c" using assms by simp
  then have "4 = 3 * c" using assms by simp
  then have "c = 4 / 3" by simp
  have "5 * b = 3 * c" using assms by simp
  then have "5 * b = 4" using \<open>c = 4 / 3\<close> by simp
  then have "b = 4 / 5" by simp
  have "4 * a = 4" using assms by simp
  then have "a = 1" by simp
  have "3 * c = 4" using \<open>c = 4 / 3\<close> by simp
  then have "c = 4 / 3" by simp
  have "d = 4 - (1 + 4/3 + 4/5)" using assms by simp
  then have "d = 13/15" by simp
  have "fst (quotient_of (13/15)) + snd (quotient_of (13/15)) = 28" by eval
  show ?thesis using \<open>d = 13/15\<close> by (metis \<open>fst (quotient_of (13 / 15)) + snd (quotient_of (13 / 15)) = 28\<close>)
qed

  have eq2: "?a + 10 * ?d = 60"
    using assms by simp
  have "4 * ?d = 30"
    using eq2 eq1 by simp
  then have eq3: "?d = 15/2"
    by simp

  then show ?thesis

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"

  also have "... = 36 * b" by simp
  also have "... = (36/9) * (9*b)" by simp
  also have "... = (36/9) * (20*c)" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 80 * c" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma quotient_of_d:
  fixes a b c d::rat
  assumes "a = 1" "b = 4/5" "c = 4/3"
    and "3 * a = b + c + d"
    and "4 * b = a + c + d"
    and "2 * c = a + b + d"
  shows "fst (quotient_of d) + snd (quotient_of d) = 28"
proof -
  have c0: "a = 1" using assms by simp
  have c1: "b = 4/5" using assms by simp
  have c2: "c = 4/3" using assms by simp
  have c3: "3 * a = b + c + d" using assms by simp
  have c4: "4 * b = a + c + d" using assms by simp
  have c5: "2 * c = a + b + d" using assms by simp
  have c6: "4 * a = 3 * c" using c0 c2 by simp
  have c7: "5 * b = 3 * c" using c1 c2 by simp
  have c8: "4 * a = 4" using c6 by (metis c0 mult.right_neutral)
  have c9: "5 * b = 4" using c7 by (metis c0 c6 mult.right_neutral semiring_norm(3))
  have c10: "3 * c = 4" using c2 by simp
  have c11: "d = 4 - (1 + 4/3 + 4/5)" using c3 c4 c5 c8 c9 c10 by simp
  have c12: "d = 13/15" using c11 by simp
  have c13: "fst (quotient_of (13/15)) + snd (quotient_of (13/15)) = 28" by eval
  show ?thesis using c12 c13 by blast
qed

lemma mult_zero_iff:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "a * b = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> a = 0 \<or> b = 0"
  by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "180 = ?a * (27 - ?a)"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "0 = ?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "(?a - 12) * (?a - 15) = 0"
    using eq5 by sos
  have eq7: "?a = 12 \<or> ?a = 15"
    using eq6 mult_zero_iff by auto
  have eq8: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq9: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq7 eq8 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  have c0: "\<And>(x::real). f x = a*x^4 - b*x^2 + x + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  have c1: "f (-3) = a*(-3)^4 - b*(-3)^2 + (-3) + 5" using c0 by simp
  have c2: "f 3 = a*(3)^4 - b*(3)^2 + (3) + 5" using c0 by simp
  have c3: "f 3 - f (-3) = (a*(3)^4 - b*(3)^2 + (3) + 5) - (a*(-3)^4 - b*(-3)^2 + (-3) + 5)" using c1 c2 by simp
  have c4: "f 3 = f (-3) + 6" using c3 by simp
  have c5: "f 3 = 2 + 6" using c4 assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  have "5 * (a + b + c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  then have "5 * (a + b + c) = 25"
    by simp
  then have "a + b + c = 5"
    by simp
  then have "2 * a = -8"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "2 * b = 4"
    using assms(2) by (smt (verit) assms(3))
  then have "2 * c = 14"
    using assms(3) by (smt (verit) assms(2))
  then have "a = -4"
    by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * a = - 8\<close>)
  then have "b = 2"
    by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * b = 4\<close>)
  then have "c = 7"
    by (metis \<open>2 * b = 4\<close> \<open>a + b + c = 5\<close> \<open>a = - 4\<close> add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' add_diff_cancel_right' add_minus_cancel dbl_dec_def dbl_dec_simps(5) dbl_def dbl_inc_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(4) diff_add_cancel diff_minus_eq_add left_add_twice minus_add_cancel minus_diff_eq minus_real_def mult_2 semiring_norm(26) semiring_norm(27) uminus_add_conv_diff verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "a * b * c = -4 * 2 * 7"
    by (metis \<open>a = - 4\<close> \<open>b = 2\<close>)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  have "5 * (a + b + c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  then have "5 * (a + b + c) = 25"
    by simp
  then have "a + b + c = 5"
    by simp
  then have "2 * a = -8"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "2 * b = 4"
    using assms(2) by (smt (verit) assms(3))
  then have "2 * c = 14"
    using assms(3) by (smt (verit) assms(2))
  then have "a = -4"
    by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * a = - 8\<close>)
  then have "b = 2"
    by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * b = 4\<close>)
  then have "c = 7"
    by (metis \<open>2 * b = 4\<close> \<open>a + b + c = 5\<close> \<open>a = - 4\<close> add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' add_diff_cancel_right' add_minus_cancel dbl_dec_def dbl_dec_simps(5) dbl_def dbl_inc_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(4) diff_add_cancel diff_minus_eq_add left_add_twice minus_add_cancel minus_diff_eq minus_real_def mult_2 semiring_norm(26) semiring_norm(27) uminus_add_conv_diff verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "a * b * c = -4 * 2 * 7"
    by (metis \<open>a = - 4\<close> \<open>b = 2\<close>)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma mathd_algebra_171':
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 5 * x + 4"
    and "f a = b"
    and "f c = d"
  shows "a = (b - 4) / 5" "c = (d - 4) / 5"
proof -
  have "f a = 5 * a + 4"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "5 * a + 4 = b"
    using assms(2) by simp
  then have "5 * a = b - 4"
    by simp
  then have "a = (b - 4) / 5"
    by simp
  then show "a = (b - 4) / 5"
    by simp
next
  have "f c = 5 * c + 4"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "5 * c + 4 = d"
    using assms(3) by simp
  then have "5 * c = d - 4"
    by simp
  then have "c = (d - 4) / 5"
    by simp
  then show "c = (d - 4) / 5"
    by simp
qed

  finally show ?thesis

theorem mathd_algebra_362:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 * b^3 = 32 / 27"
    and "a / b^3 = 27 / 4" 
  shows "a + b = 8 / 3"
proof -
  have "b^3 = (4 / 27) * a"
    using assms(2) by (rule rearrange_equation)
  then have "(4 / 27) * a * a^2 = 32 / 27"
    using assms(1) by sos
  then have "a^3 = 32 / 4"
    by sos
  then have "a = 2"
    by sos
  then have "b^3 = 8 / 27"
    using assms(2) by (smt (verit) L2_set_mult_ineq_lemma One_nat_def Suc_1 Suc_numeral \<open>b ^ 3 = 4 / 27 * a\<close> divide_eq_0_iff divide_self_if field_sum_of_halves four_x_squared nat_1_add_1 numeral_3_eq_3 numeral_One numerals(1) one_le_power one_power2 plus_1_eq_Suc power2_sum power_0 power_add power_add_numeral power_le_one power_mult_distrib power_one_right times_divide_eq_left)
  then have "b = 2 / 3"
    by sos
  then have "a + b = 2 + 2 / 3"
    by (metis \<open>a = 2\<close>)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma rearrange_equation:

  assumes "a / b^3 = 27 / 4"
  shows "b^3 = (4 / 27) * a"
proof -

    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)

theorem mathd_algebra_362:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 * b^3 = 32 / 27"
    and "a / b^3 = 27 / 4" 
  shows "a + b = 8 / 3"
proof -
  have "b^3 = (4 / 27) * a"
    using assms(2) by (rule rearrange_equation)
  hence "a^2 * ((4 / 27) * a) = 32 / 27"
    using assms(1) by presburger
  hence "a^3 = 32 / 4"
    by sos
  hence "a = 2"
    by sos
  hence "b^3 = 8 / 27"
    using assms(2) by (smt (verit) L2_set_mult_ineq_lemma One_nat_def Suc_1 Suc_numeral \<open>b ^ 3 = 4 / 27 * a\<close> divide_eq_0_iff divide_self_if field_sum_of_halves four_x_squared nat_1_add_1 numeral_3_eq_3 numeral_One numerals(1) one_le_power one_power2 plus_1_eq_Suc power2_sum power_0 power_add power_add_numeral power_le_one power_mult_distrib power_one_right times_divide_eq_left)
  hence "b = 2 / 3"
    by sos
  hence "a + b = 8 / 3"
    using \<open>a = 2\<close> by simp
  thus ?thesis
    by simp
qed

  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

  have "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = ((3 * n) + 18) mod 9"
    using mathd_numbertheory_582_lemma1 by simp
  also have "... = (3 * n) mod 9 + 18 mod 9"
    using mod_add_eq by presburger
  also have "... = 0 + 18 mod 9"
    using assms(2) mathd_numbertheory_582_lemma2 mathd_numbertheory_582_lemma3 by simp
  also have "... = 0"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis

  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "5 * x = y"
    and  "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30"

  have "6 * x - 6 + 6 = 30 + 6" using c0 by auto

lemma factors_of_number:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "{f. f dvd n} = {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
proof -
  have "{f. f dvd n} \<subseteq> {f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n}"
    by (metis Collect_mono assms conj_subset_def dvd_0_left less_numeral_extra(3) subset_refl zero_less_iff_neq_zero)
  moreover have "{f. f > 0 \<and> f dvd n} \<subseteq> {f. f dvd n}"

  ultimately show ?thesis

qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_100:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10"
      and "lcm n 40 = 280" 
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  have "gcd n 40 * lcm n 40 = n * 40"
    using assms(1) assms(2) gcd_times_lcm[of n 40] by presburger
  then have "10 * 280 = n * 40" by (metis assms(1) assms(2))
  then have "280 = n * 4" by simp
  then have "70 = n" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

proof (cases "n \<le> 1")

  then have "n > 1" by simp

lemma mathd_numbertheory_150_lemma1:
  fixes n::nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(\<not> 2 dvd (30 * n + 7)) \<and> (\<not> 3 dvd (30 * n + 7)) \<and> (\<not> 5 dvd (30 * n + 7))"
proof -
  have "30 * n + 7 = 3 * (10 * n + 2) + 1"
    by auto
  hence "\<not> 2 dvd (30 * n + 7)"
    by simp
  moreover have "30 * n + 7 = 2 * (15 * n + 3) + 1"
    by auto
  hence "\<not> 3 dvd (30 * n + 7)"
    by presburger
  moreover have "30 * n + 7 = 5 * (6 * n + 1) + 2"
    by auto
  hence "\<not> 5 dvd (30 * n + 7)"
    by presburger
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by blast
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have eq1: "?a * ?b = 180"
    using assms(1) by auto
  have eq2: "2 * (?a + ?b) = 54"
    using assms(2) by auto
  have eq3: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq2 by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  have eq4: "180 = ?a * (27 - ?a)"
    using eq1 eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "0 = ?a^2 - 27 * ?a + 180"
    using eq4 by sos
  have eq6: "(?a - 12) * (?a - 15) = 0"
    using eq5 by sos
  have eq7: "?a = 12 \<or> ?a = 15"
    using eq6 mult_zero_iff by auto
  have eq8: "?b = 27 - ?a"
    using eq3 by auto
  have eq9: "?a^2 + ?b^2 = 369"
    using eq7 eq8 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

  also have "... = d * c" using assms by simp

qed

lemma mod_power:
  fixes a b n :: int

qed

theorem mod_division:
  fixes a b n :: nat
  assumes "a = b * n"
  shows "a mod b = 0"
proof -
  have "a = b * n" using assms by simp
  then have "a = b * (a div b)" by simp
  then have "a = (b * (a div b)) + (a mod b)" by (metis mult_div_mod_eq)
  then have "a = b * (a div b) + (a mod b)" by simp
  then have "(a mod b) = a - b * (a div b)" by arith
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>a = b * (a div b)\<close> add_cancel_right_left mod_0 mult_zero_right nat_mod_eq_iff verit_sum_simplify)
qed

theorem induction_11div10tonmn1ton:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(11::int) dvd (10^n - (-1)^n)"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  have "10 mod 11 = -1 mod 11" by simp
  then have "(10 mod 11)^0 = (-1 mod 11)^0" by (metis power_0)
  then have "10^0 = (-1)^0" by simp
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume "(11::int) dvd (10^n - (-1)^n)"
  then have "11 dvd (10^n - (-1)^n)" by simp
  then have "11 dvd (10 * (10^n) - 10 * (-1)^n + (-1)^1)" by simp
  then have "11 dvd (10^(n+1) - (-1)^(n+1))" by (simp add: power_add)
  then show ?case by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_483:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes "a 1 = 1"
    and "a 2 = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. a (n + 2) = a (n + 1) + a n" 
    and "\<forall> n. a n>0"
  shows "(a 100) mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  have "fibonacci 0 mod 4 = 0" by simp
  have "fibonacci 1 mod 4 = 1" using assms(1) by simp
  have "fibonacci 2 mod 4 = 1" using assms(2) by eval
  have "fibonacci 3 mod 4 = 2" using assms(3) by eval
  have "fibonacci 4 mod 4 = 3" using assms(3) by eval
  have "fibonacci 5 mod 4 = 1" using assms(3) by eval
  have "fibonacci 6 mod 4 = 0" using assms(3) by eval
  have "fibonacci (n + 6) mod 4 = fibonacci n mod 4" for n
  proof (induction n rule: nat_induct)
    case 0
    then show ?case by eval
  next
    case (Suc n)
    then show ?case by (metis Nat.add_0_right Suc_1 add.commute add_2_eq_Suc' add_Suc_right add_cancel_right_left assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) less_nat_zero_code numeral_1_eq_Suc_0 numeral_One)
  qed
  have "(a 100) mod 4 = fibonacci 100 mod 4" using assms(3) by (metis Nat.add_0_right One_nat_def Suc_1 add.commute add_Suc_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(4) gr0_implies_Suc less_nat_zero_code old.nat.inject zero_less_Suc)
  also have "... = fibonacci (100 mod 6) mod 4" using \<open>fibonacci (n + 6) mod 4 = fibonacci n mod 4\<close> by (metis One_nat_def Suc_1 add.commute add.right_neutral add_Suc_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) less_nat_zero_code nat.distinct(1) old.nat.exhaust old.nat.inject)
  also have "... = fibonacci 4 mod 4" by simp
  also have "... = 3" using \<open>fibonacci 4 mod 4 = 3\<close> by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_k_minus_1:
  fixes n k::nat
  assumes "n mod k = k - 1"
  shows "\<exists>m. n = k * m + k - 1"

    by simp
  then have "n = k * (n div k) + k - 1"
    using assms by (metis Nat.add_diff_assoc2 add.commute add.right_neutral add_cancel_right_right add_less_same_cancel1 diff_is_0_eq leI le_diff_conv le_zero_eq less_nat_zero_code less_one minus_mod_eq_mult_div mod_by_0 zero_diff)
  then show ?thesis

qed

lemma mod_congruence:
  fixes a b n :: nat
  assumes "a mod n = b mod n"
  shows "(k * a) mod n = (k * b) mod n"
proof -
  have "a mod n = b mod n \<Longrightarrow> (\<exists>k::nat. a = b + k * n \<or> b = a + k * n)" 
    by (metis assms mod_eq_nat1E mult.commute nle_le)
  then obtain k where "a = b + k * n \<or> b = a + k * n" using assms by auto
  then have "k * a = k * b + k * k * n \<or> k * b = k * a + k * k * n" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "k * a mod n = k * b mod n" by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms mod_mult_cong mult.commute)
qed

lemma mod_exp_cong:
  fixes a b m n :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b mod m"
  shows "a^n mod m = b^n mod m"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "a^n mod m = b^n mod m" using Suc.IH assms by simp
  then have "a^n * (a mod m) mod m = b^n * (b mod m) mod m" using assms by (metis mod_mult_cong)
  then have "a^n * a mod m = b^n * b mod m" by (metis mod_mult_right_eq)
  then have "a^(Suc n) mod m = b^(Suc n) mod m" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show ?case by simp
qed

  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(\<Sum> k\<in> {1..Suc n}. k) = (\<Sum> k\<in> {1..n}. k) + (Suc n)" by simp
  also have "... = (n * (n + 1)) div 2 + (Suc n)" using Suc.hyps by simp
  also have "... = ((n + 1) * (n + 2)) div 2" by simp
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_arithmetic_sequence:
  fixes a d n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum> i = a..(a + n). i) = (n + 1) * (2 * a + n) div 2"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(\<Sum> i = a..(a + Suc n). i) = (\<Sum> i = a..(a + n). i) + (a + Suc n)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (n + 1) * (2 * a + n) div 2 + (a + Suc n)"
    using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = (n + 2) * (2 * a + (n + 1)) div 2"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

  "digits 0 = []" |
  "digits n = digits (n div 10) @ [n mod 10]"

lemma substitution:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a = 1"
    and "b = 3"
    and "c = 4"
  shows "a + b + c = 8"
proof -
  have "a + b + c = 1 + 3 + 4" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 8" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma natural_number_properties:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9"
    and "1 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 9"
    and "1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 9"
    and "a \<noteq> b"
    and "a \<noteq> c"
    and "b \<noteq> c"
    and "a + b = c"
    and "10 * a + a - b = 2 * c"
    and "c * b = 10 * a + a + a"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 3 \<and> c = 4"
proof -
  have "b < a + b" using assms by simp
  then have "b < c" using assms by simp
  then have "c = 4 \<or> c = 5 \<or> c = 6 \<or> c = 7 \<or> c = 8 \<or> c = 9" using assms by auto
  moreover have "c \<noteq> 5" using assms by auto
  moreover have "c \<noteq> 7" using assms by auto
  moreover have "c \<noteq> 8" using assms by auto
  moreover have "c \<noteq> 9" using assms by auto
  ultimately have "c = 4 \<or> c = 6" by auto
  then consider (1) "c = 4" | (2) "c = 6" by auto
  then show "a = 1 \<and> b = 3 \<and> c = 4"
  proof cases
    case 1
    have "10 * a + a - b = 2 * c" using assms by simp
    then have "10 * a + a - b = 8" using 1 by simp
    then have "10 * a + a = b + 8" by simp
    then have "11 * a \<le> b + 8" by simp
    then have "11 * a \<le> 9 + 8" using assms by simp
    then have "11 * a \<le> 17" by simp
    then have "a \<le> 1" by simp
    then have "a = 1" using assms by simp
    then have "b = 3" using assms 1 by simp
    then show ?thesis using assms 1 by simp
  next
    case 2
    have "10 * a + a - b = 2 * c" using assms by simp
    then have "10 * a + a - b = 12" using 2 by simp
    then have "10 * a + a = b + 12" by simp
    then have "11 * a \<le> b + 12" by simp
    then have "11 * a \<le> 9 + 12" using assms by simp
    then have "11 * a \<le> 21" by simp
    then have "a \<le> 1" by simp
    then have "a = 1" using assms by simp
    then have "b = 3" using assms 2 by simp
    then show ?thesis using assms 2 by simp
  qed
qed

  shows "a + b + c = 1 + b + c"

lemma gcd_multiple:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "gcd a b = c"
  shows "a mod c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> b mod c = 0"
proof
  assume "a mod c = 0"
  then obtain k where k_def: "a = c * k" by auto
  have "gcd a b = gcd (c * k) b" by (simp add: k_def)
  also have "... = gcd c b" using assms(1) by (metis add_cancel_right_right assms(3) assms(4) calculation gcd.commute gcd_nat.right_idem gr_implies_not_zero less_add_eq_less mult_right_cancel)
  also have "... = gcd b c" by (simp add: gcd.commute)
  also have "... = c" using assms(4) by auto
  finally have "c dvd b" by auto
  then obtain m where m_def: "b = c * m" using dvd_def by blast
  then have "b mod c = (c * m) mod c" by simp
  also have "... = 0" by simp
  finally show "b mod c = 0" by simp
next
  assume "b mod c = 0"
  then obtain k where k_def: "b = c * k" by auto
  have "gcd a b = gcd a (c * k)" by (simp add: k_def)
  also have "... = gcd a c" using assms(2) by (metis assms(1) assms(4) calculation canonically_ordered_monoid_add_class.lessE gcd_nat.left_idem mult_right_cancel)
  also have "... = gcd c a" by (simp add: gcd.commute)
  also have "... = c" using assms(4) by auto
  finally have "c dvd a" by auto
  then obtain m where m_def: "a = c * m" using dvd_def by blast
  then have "a mod c = (c * m) mod c" by simp
  also have "... = 0" by simp
  finally show "a mod c = 0" by simp
qed

lemma math_numbertheory_335:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = 5"
  shows "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4"
proof -
  have "(5 * n) mod 7 = (5 * 5) mod 7" using h0
    by presburger
  then have "(5 * n) mod 7 = 25 mod 7"
    by simp
  then have "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma euclidean_algorithm:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "gcd a b = gcd (b mod a) a"
proof -
  have "gcd a b = gcd (a mod b) b" using gcd_red_nat by (metis bits_div_by_0 gcd_mod_left mod_eq_self_iff_div_eq_0)
  also have "... = gcd (b mod a) a" by (metis calculation gcd.commute gcd_red_nat)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_185:
  fixes n ::nat
  assumes "n mod 5 = 3" 
  shows "(2 * n) mod 5 = 1"
proof -
  have "(2 * n) mod 5 = (n + n) mod 5" by presburger
  also have "... = (3 + 3) mod 5" using assms by presburger
  also have "... = 6 mod 5" by simp
  also have "... = 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma euclidean_algorithm:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "gcd a b = gcd (b mod a) a"
proof (cases "a = 0")
  case True
  then have "gcd a b = b" by simp
  also have "... = gcd (b mod a) a" using True by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
next
  case False
  have "gcd a b = gcd (b mod a + a * (b div a)) a"
    by (metis gcd.commute mod_mult_div_eq)
  also have "... = gcd (b mod a) a"
    by (metis calculation gcd.commute gcd_red_nat)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_247:
  fixes n ::nat
  assumes "(3 * n) mod 2 = 11" 
  shows "n mod 11 = 8"
proof -
  have "(3 * n) mod 2 = (-9) mod 11"
    using assms by simp
  then have "n mod 2 = (-3) mod 11"
    using assms by simp
  then have "n mod 2 = 8 mod 11"
    by simp
  then have "n mod 2 = 8"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    using assms by simp
qed

lemma power_mod:
  fixes x a p :: nat
  assumes "a > 0"
  shows "(x^a) mod p = ((x mod p)^a) mod p"
  by (metis mod_mod_trivial power_mod)

theorem mathd_numbertheory_185:
  fixes n ::nat
  assumes "n mod 5 = 3" 
  shows "(2 * n) mod 5 = 1"
proof -
  have "(2 * n) mod 5 = (n + n) mod 5" by presburger
  also have "... = (3 + 3) mod 5" using assms by presburger
  also have "... = 6 mod 5" by simp
  also have "... = 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_100:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10"
      and "lcm n 40 = 280" 
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  have "gcd n 40 * lcm n 40 = n * 40"
    using assms(1) assms(2) gcd_times_lcm[of n 40] by presburger
  then have "10 * 280 = n * 40" by (metis assms(1) assms(2))
  then have "280 = n * 4" by simp
  then have "70 = n" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mod_division:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a mod b = c"
  shows "a = b * (a div b) + c"
proof -
  have "a = b * (a div b) + a mod b" by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by simp
qed

lemma cal_log_exp_value:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "a ≠ 1" "n > 0"
  shows "log a (a^n) = n"
proof -
  have c0: "log a a = 1"
    by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2))
  have "log a (a^n) = n * (log a a)"
    using log_nat_power[of a a n] by (simp add: assms(1))
  then have c1: "log a (a^n) = n"
    using c0 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: c1)
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_125:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "5 * x = y"
    and  "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30" 
  shows "x = 6"
proof -
  have c0: "6 * x - 6 = 30" using assms by auto
  have "6 * x - 6 + 6 = 30 + 6" using c0 by auto
  then have "6 * x = 36" by auto
  then have "x = 6" by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_125:

  assumes "5 * x = y"
    and  "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30" 
  shows "x = 6"

  then have "5 * x + x - 6 = 30" using assms by auto
  then have "6 * x - 6 = 30" by auto
  then have "x - 1 = 5" by auto
  then have "x = 6" by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma division_remainder:
  fixes a b m :: int
  assumes "a = b * m + r"
  shows "a mod m = r mod m"
proof -
  from assms have "a = b * m + r" by simp
  then have "a mod m = (b * m + r) mod m" by simp
  then have "a mod m = (b * m) mod m + r mod m" by (simp add: mod_add_eq)
  then have "a mod m = 0 + r mod m" by simp
  then have "a mod m = r mod m" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma modular_arithmetic_properties:
  fixes a b c m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b mod m"
  shows 
    "(a + c) mod m = (b + c) mod m"
    "(a * c) mod m = (b * c) mod m"
    "(a^n) mod m = (b^n) mod m"
proof -
  show "(a + c) mod m = (b + c) mod m"
    using assms by (metis mod_add_cong)
  show "(a * c) mod m = (b * c) mod m"
    using assms by (metis mod_mult_cong)
  show "(a^n) mod m = (b^n) mod m"
    using assms by (smt (verit) power_mod)
qed

    and "c > 0"
  shows "a^c mod m = b^c mod m"

    using assms(2) power_mod by metis
  also have "... = (b mod m)^c mod m"
    using assms(1) by simp
  finally show ?thesis by (metis assms(1) cong_def cong_pow)

theorem modular_arithmetic:
  fixes a b m :: nat
  assumes "(a * b) mod m = c mod m"
  shows "a mod m * b mod m = c mod m"
proof -
  have "(a * b) mod m = (a mod m * b mod m) mod m"
    by (metis mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_left_eq)
  also have "... = (a mod m * b) mod m"
    by (simp add: mod_mult_left_eq)
  finally have "(a * b) mod m = (a mod m * b) mod m" .

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum>i\<in>{1..n}. (2*i-1)) = n^2"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(\<Sum>i\<in>{1..Suc n}. (2*i-1)) = (\<Sum>i\<in>{1..n}. (2*i-1)) + (2*(Suc n)-1)"
    by simp
  also have "... = n^2 + (2*(Suc n)-1)"
    using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = (n+1)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed
